inlineContent.text: framework exposes custom macros which can be used to generate dynamic
implementations. The core of the framework is
macro which generates the implementation aided by data provided with using other macros.
aims to supercharge your
implementations by providing these inbox features:
Allows custom
value declaration per variable with
passing single argument, instead of requiring you to write all the
values.
Allows to create flattened model for nested
values with
and
Allows to create composition of multiple
types with
passing no arguments.
Allows to read data from additional fallback
s provided with
Allows to provide default value in case of decoding failures with
, or only in case of failures when missing value with
. Different default values can also be used for value missing and other errors respectively with
Allows to create custom decoding/encoding strategies with
and using them with
or others. i.e.
etc.
Allows applying common strategies like
to all properties of a type through the
parameter, reducing the need for repetitive property annotations.
Allows specifying different case values with
and case value/protocol type identifier type different from
with
or arbitrary primitive values with
Allows specifying enum-case/protocol type identifier path with
and case content path with
Allows decoding/encoding enums that lack distinct identifiers for each case data with
Allows to ignore specific properties/cases from decoding/encoding with
and
. Allows to ignore encoding based on custom conditions with
and
Allows to use camel-case names for variables according to
, while enabling a type/case to work with different case style keys with
Allows to ignore all initialized properties of a type/case from decoding/encoding with
unless explicitly asked to decode/encode by attaching any coding attributes, i.e.
etc.
Allows to generate protocol decoding/encoding
s with
build tool plugin from
types.
